description:
gTech’s Strategy and Operations team (gSO) is made up of strategic partners and trusted advisors that drive success and transformative changes for gTech. We create value through deep functional and business expertise combined with analytical rigor to formulate and deliver strategies. Using core capabilities ― strategy, analytics, and communications ― we empower gTech to do amazing things to land the present, and build for the future.

Specializing in operational reporting, data insights and data analysis, the Analytics and Insights team leverages big datasets, analytical tools, and business partnering to help global advertising business organizations provide exceptional customer experience and drive smart business decisions.

As a Global Programs Analyst, you will provide thought leadership and problem-solving skills to strategic planning projects. Working directly with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams, you will be the data-driven voice on global projects with a focus on improving customer experience and increasing efficiency. You will utilize data analysis to build compelling strategy proposals and stay engaged in helping regional leadership to execute on agreed plans.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Science, Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in an analytical role in management consulting, or in a business operations and analytics environment.
  • Experience writing SQL queries, working with large data sets and developing analytical solutions for complex business problems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA, Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative field.
  • Experience with stakeholder management and ability to influence senior stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of statistics and data analysis including R programming or other statistical software packages.
  • Effective organizational, project management, communication and presentation skills.
responsibilities:
• Deliver insights and provide data based insights and recommendations on major projects and initiatives. Focus on delivering value to customers and stakeholders.
  • Operate seamlessly between being a business-savvy internal consultant and a technical business analyst.
  • Synthesize analytics requests from internal partners, adapt and prioritize based on bigger picture business problems.
  • Gather relevant data to conduct analysis and make strategic recommendations for the global Google Ads Global Customer Experience (GCE) Organization.
  • Deliver compelling presentations of insights and recommendations to multiple levels of senior stakeholders.
title: Global Programs Analyst
